text.p: Lehman Brothers said in a report released on Tuesday it had raised its 1997 and 1998 EPS estimates for Tecnomatix Technologies Ltd, citing the Israeli company's "excellent" first quarter performance.
Lehman raised its 1997 EPS estimate to $1.10 from $1.05 and its 1998 EPS forecast to $1.40 from $1.38.
"Tecnomatix continues to demonstrate its leadership position in the rapidly growing computer aided production engineering market," the report said, maintaining a 1-buy rating.

"Tecnomatix's first quarter EPS came well ahead of our estimate, representing the eighth consecutive quarter that the company has surpassed our expectations. EPS for the period totalled $0.20, up 54 percent year over year and 18 percent ahead of our expectations," it said.
